While the model has a high success rate in parallel tool calling without prompting, you can boost this to ~100% or adjust the aggression level:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"69:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"\u003cuse_parallel_tool_calls\u003e\\nIf you intend to call multiple tools and there are no dependencies between the tool calls, make all of the independent tool calls in parallel. Prioritize calling tools simultaneously whenever the actions can be done in parallel rather than sequentially. For example, when reading 3 files, run 3 tool calls in parallel to read all 3 files into context at the same time. Maximize use of parallel tool calls where possible to increase speed and efficiency. However, if some tool calls depend on previous calls to inform dependent values like the parameters, do NOT call these tools in parallel and instead call them sequentially. Never use placeholders or guess missing parameters in tool calls.\\n\u003c/use_parallel_tool_calls\u003e\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt for maximum parallel efficiency\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"6a:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Execute operations sequentially with brief pauses between each step to ensure stability.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt to reduce parallel execution\"}]\n6b:[\"$\",\"h2\",null,{\"className\":\"font-heading leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"thinking-and-reasoning\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":2,\"children\":\"Thinking and reasoning\"}]}]\n6c:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"overthinking-and-excessive-thoroughness\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Overthinking and excessive thoroughness\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"6d:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"Claude Opus 4.6 does significantly more upfront exploration than previous models, especially at higher \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"effort\"}],\" settings. This initial work often helps to optimize the final results, but the model may gather extensive context or pursue multiple threads of research without being prompted. If your prompts previously encouraged the model to be more thorough, you should tune that guidance for Claude Opus 4.6:\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"6e:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ul\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Replace blanket defaults with more targeted instructions.\"}],\" Instead of \\\"Default to using [tool],\\\" add guidance like \\\"Use [tool] when it would enhance your understanding of the problem.\\\"\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Remove over-prompting.\"}],\" Tools that undertriggered in previous models are likely to trigger appropriately now. Instructions like \\\"If in doubt, use [tool]\\\" will cause overtriggering.\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Use effort as a fallback.\"}],\" If Claude continues to be overly aggressive, use a lower setting for \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"effort\"}],\".\"]}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"6f:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"In some cases, Claude Opus 4.6 may think extensively, which can inflate thinking tokens and slow down responses. If this behavior is undesirable, you can add explicit instructions to constrain its reasoning, or you can lower the \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"effort\"}],\" setting to reduce overall thinking and token usage.\"]}]}]\n70:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"When you're deciding how to approach a problem, choose an approach and commit to it. Avoid revisiting decisions unless you encounter new information that directly contradicts your reasoning. If you're weighing two approaches, pick one and see it through. You can always course-correct later if the chosen approach fails.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n71:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For Claude Sonnet 4.6 specifically, switching from adaptive to extended thinking with a \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"budget_tokens\"}],\" cap provides a hard ceiling on thinking costs while preserving quality.\"]}]}]\n72:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"leverage-thinking-and-interleaved-thinking-capabilities\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Leverage thinking \u0026 interleaved thinking capabilities\"}]}]\n73:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models offer thinking capabilities that can be especially helpful for tasks involving reflection after tool use or complex multi-step reasoning. You can guide its initial or interleaved thin"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"king for better results.\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"74:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"Claude Opus 4.6 uses \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"adaptive thinking\"}],\" (\",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"thinking: {type: \\\"adaptive\\\"}\"}],\"), where Claude dynamically decides when and how much to think. Claude Sonnet 4.6 supports both adaptive thinking and manual extended thinking with \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/extended-thinking#interleaved-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"interleaved mode\"}],\". Claude calibrates its thinking based on two factors: the \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"effort\"}],\" parameter and query complexity. Higher effort elicits more thinking, and more complex queries do the same. On easier queries that don't require thinking, the model responds directly. In internal evaluations, adaptive thinking reliably drives better performance than extended thinking, and we recommend moving to adaptive thinking to get the most intelligent responses.\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"75:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For Sonnet 4.6, consider trying adaptive thinking for workloads that require agentic behavior such as multi-step tool use, complex coding tasks, and long-horizon agent loops. If adaptive thinking doesn't fit your use case, manual extended thinking with interleaved mode remains supported. Older models use manual thinking mode with \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"budget_tokens\"}],\".\"]}]}]\n76:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"You can guide Claude's thinking behavior:\"}]}]\n77:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"After receiving tool results, carefully reflect on their quality and determine optimal next steps before proceeding. Use your thinking to plan and iterate based on this new information, and then take the best next action.\",\"label\":\"Example prompt\"}]\n78:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"The triggering behavior for adaptive thinking is promptable. If you find the model thinking more often than you'd like, which can happen with large or complex system prompts, add guidance to steer it:\"}]}]\n79:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Extended thinking adds latency and should only be used when it will meaningfully improve answer quality - typically for problems that require multi-step reasoning. When in doubt, respond directly.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"7a:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 It will generalize that style to its own extended thinking blocks.\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Manual CoT as a fallback.\"}],\" When thinking is off, you can still encourage step-by-step reasoning by asking Claude to think through the problem. Use structured tags like \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"\u003cthinking\u003e\"}],\" and \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"\u003canswer\u003e\"}],\" to cleanly separate reasoning from the final output.\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Ask Claude to self-check.\"}],\" Append something like \\\"Before you finish, verify your answer against [test criteria].\\\" This catches errors reliably, especially for coding and math.\"]}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"7f:[\"$\",\"$Ld4\",null,{\"children\":\"When extended thinking is disabled, Claude Opus 4.5 is particularly sensitive to the word \\\"think\\\" and its variants. Consider using alternatives like \\\"consider,\\\" \\\"evaluate,\\\" or \\\"reason through\\\" in those cases.\"}]\n80:[\"$\",\"$Ldb\",null,{\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For more information on thinking capabilities, see \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/extended-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"Extended thinking\"}],\" and \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"Adaptive thinking\"}],\".\"]}]}]}]\n81:[\"$\",\"h2\",null,{\"className\":\"font-heading leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"agentic-systems\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":2,\"children\":\"Agentic systems\"}]}]\n82:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"long-horizon-reasoning-and-state-tracking\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Long-horizon reasoning and state tracking\"}]}]\n83:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models excel at long-horizon reasoning tasks with exceptional state tracking capabilities. Claude maintains orientation across extended sessions by focusing on incremental progress, making steady advances on a few things at a time rather than attempting everything at once. This capability especially emerges over multiple context windows or task iterations, where Claude can work on a complex task, save the state, and continue with a fresh context window.\"}]}]\n84:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"context-awareness-and-multi-window-workflows\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":4,\"children\":\"Context awa"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"reness and multi-window workflows\"}]}]\n85:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"Claude 4.6 and Claude 4.5 models feature \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/context-windows#context-awareness-in-claude-sonnet-4-6-sonnet-4-5-and-haiku-4-5\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"context awareness\"}],\", enabling the model to track its remaining context window (i.e. \\\"token budget\\\") throughout a conversation. This enables Claude to execute tasks and manage context more effectively by understanding how much space it has to work.\"]}]}]\n86:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Managing context limits:\"}]}]}]\n87:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"If you are using Claude in an agent harness that compacts context or allows saving context to external files (like in Claude Code), consider adding this information to your prompt so Claude can behave accordingly. Otherwise, Claude may sometimes naturally try to wrap up work as it approaches the context limit. Below is an example prompt:\"}]}]\n88:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Your context window will be automatically compacted as it approaches its limit, allowing you to continue working indefinitely from where you left off. Therefore, do not stop tasks early due to token budget concerns. As you approach your token budget limit, save your current progress and state to memory before the context window refreshes. Always be as persistent and autonomous as possible and complete tasks fully, even if the end of your budget is approaching. Never artificially stop any task early regardless of the context remaining.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n89:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"chil"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"dren\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"The \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/agents-and-tools/tool-use/memory-tool\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"memory tool\"}],\" pairs naturally with context awareness for seamless context transitions.\"]}]}]\n8a:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"multi-context-window-workflows\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":4,\"children\":\"Multi-context window workflows\"}]}]\n8b:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"For tasks spanning multiple context windows:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"8c:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ol\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:[counter-reset:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Use a different prompt for the very first context window\"}],\": Use the first context window to set up a framework (write tests, create setup scripts), then use future context windows to iterate on a todo-list.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] create tests before starting work and keep track of them in a structured format (e.g., \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"tests.json\"}],\"). This leads to better long-term ability to iterate. Remind Claude of the importance of tests: \\\"It is unacceptable to remove or edit tests because this could lead to missing or buggy functionality.\\\"\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Set up quality of life tools\"}],\": Encourage Claude to create setup scripts (e.g., \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"init.sh\"}],\") to gracefully start servers, run test suites, and linters. This prevents repeated work when continuing from a fresh context window.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Starting fresh vs compacting\"}],\": When a context window is cleared, consider starting with a brand new context window rather than using compaction. Claude's latest models are extremely effective at discovering state from the local filesystem. In some cases, you may want to take advantage of this over compaction. Be prescriptive about how it should start:\"]}]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ul\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":\"\\\"Call pwd; you can only read and write files in this directory.\\\"\"}],\"\\n\",\"$Ldc\",\"\\n\",\"$Ldd\",\"\\n\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",\"$Lde\",\"\\n\",\"$Ldf\",\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"8d:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"This is a very long task, so it may be beneficial to plan out your work clearly. Continue working systematically until you have completed this task.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n8e:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"90:[\"$\",\"$L28\",null,{\"title\":\"Example: State tracking\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"json\",\"code\":\"// Structured state file (tests.json)\\n{\\n \\\"tests\\\": [\\n { \\\"id\\\": 1, \\\"name\\\": \\\"authentication_flow\\\", \\\"status\\\": \\\"passing\\\" },\\n { \\\"id\\\": 2, \\\"name\\\": \\\"user_management\\\", \\\"status\\\": \\\"failing\\\" },\\n { \\\"id\\\": 3, \\\"name\\\": \\\"api_endpoints\\\", \\\"status\\\": \\\"not_started\\\" }\\n ],\\n \\\"total\\\": 200,\\n \\\"passing\\\": 150,\\n \\\"failing\\\": 25,\\n \\\"not_started\\\": 25\\n}\",\"highlightedHtml\":\"$e0\"}],\"$Le1\"]}]\n91:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"balancing-autonomy-and-safety\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Balancing autonomy and safety\"}]}]\n92:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Without guidance, Claude Opus 4.6 may take actions that are difficult to reverse or affect shared systems, such as deleting files, force-pushing, or posting to external services. If you want Claude Opus 4.6 to confirm before taking potentially risky actions, add guidance to your prompt:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"93:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Consider the reversibility and potential impact of your actions. You are encouraged to take local, reversible actions like editing files or running tests, but for actions that are hard to reverse, affect shared systems, or could be destructive, ask the user before proceeding.\\n\\nExamples of actions that warrant confirmation:\\n- Destructive operations: deleting files or branches, dropping database tables, rm -rf\\n- Hard to reverse operations: git push --force, git reset --hard, amending published commits\\n- Operations visible to others: pushing code, commenting on PRs/issues, sending messages, modifying shared infrastructure\\n\\nWhen encountering obstacles, do not use destructive actions as a shortcut. For example, don't bypass safety checks (e.g. --no-verify) or discard unfamiliar files that may be in-progress work.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"94:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"research-and-information-gathering\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Research and information gathering\"}]}]\n95:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models demonstrate exceptional agentic search capabilities and can find and synthesize information from multiple sources effectively. For optimal research results:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"96:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ol\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 For simple tasks, sequential operations, single-file edits, or tasks where you need to maintain context across steps, work directly rather than delegating.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt for subagent usage\"}]\n9f:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"chain-complex-prompts\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Chain complex prompts\"}]}]\na0:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"With adaptive thinking and subagent orchestration, Claude handles most multi-step reasoning internally. This approach allows Claude to use files, especially python scripts, as a 'temporary scratchpad' before saving its final output. Using temporary files can improve outcomes particularly for agentic coding use cases.\"}]}]\na4:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"If you'd prefer to minimize net new file creation, you can instruct Claude to clean up after itself:\"}]}]\na5:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"If you create any temporary new files, scripts, or helper files for iteration, clean up these files by removing them at the end of the task.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\na6:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"overeagerness\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Overeagerness\"}]}]\na7:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 have a tendency to overengineer by creating extra files, adding unnecessary abstractions, or building in flexibility that wasn't requested. If you're seeing this undesired behavior, add specific guidance to keep solutions minimal.\"}]}]\na8:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"For example:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"a9:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Avoid over-engineering. Only make changes that are directly requested or clearly necessary. Keep solutions simple and focused:\\n\\n- Scope: Don't add features, refactor code, or make \\\"improvements\\\" beyond what was asked. A bug fix doesn't need surrounding code cleaned up. A simple feature doesn't need extra configurability.\\n\\n- Documentation: Don't add docstrings, comments, or type annotations to code you didn't change. Only add comments where the logic isn't self-evident.\\n\\n- Defensive coding: Don't add error handling, fallbacks, or validation for scenarios that can't happen. Trust internal code and framework guarantees. Only validate at system boundaries (user input, external APIs).\\n\\n- Abstractions: Don't create helpers, utilities, or abstractions for one-time operations. Don't design for hypothetical future requirements. The right amount of complexity is the minimum needed for the current task.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt to minimize overengineering\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"aa:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"avoid-focusing-on-passing-tests-and-hard-coding\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Avoid focusing on passing tests and hard-coding\"}]}]\nab:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude can sometimes focus too heavily on making tests pass at the expense of more general solutions, or may use workarounds like helper scripts for complex refactoring instead of using standard tools directly. To prevent this behavior and ensure robust, generalizable solutions:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"ac:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Please write a high-quality, general-purpose solution using the standard tools available. Do not create helper scripts or workarounds to accomplish the task more efficiently. Implement a solution that works correctly for all valid inputs, not just the test cases. Do not hard-code values or create solutions that only work for specific test inputs. Instead, implement the actual logic that solves the problem generally.\\n\\nFocus on understanding the problem requirements and implementing the correct algorithm. Tests are there to verify correctness, not to define the solution. Provide a principled implementation that follows best practices and software design principles.\\n\\nIf the task is unreasonable or infeasible, or if any of the tests are incorrect, please inform me rather than working around them. The solution should be robust, maintainable, and extendable.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"ad:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"minimizing-hallucinations-in-agentic-coding\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Minimizing hallucinations in agentic coding\"}]}]\nae:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models are less prone to hallucinations and give more accurate, grounded, intelligent answers based on the code. To encourage this behavior even more and minimize hallucinations:\"}]}]\naf:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"\u003cinvestigate_before_answering\u003e\\nNever speculate about code you have not opened. If the user references a specific file, you MUST read the file before answering. Make sure to investigate and read relevant files BEFORE answering questions about the codebase. Never make any claims about code before investigating unless you are certain of the correct answer - give grounded and hallucination-free answers.\\n\u003c/investigate_before_answering\u003e\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\nb0:[\"$\",\"h2\",null,{\"className\":\"font-heading leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"capability-specific-tips\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":2,\"children\":\"Capability-specific tips\"}]}]\nb1:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"improved-vision-capabilities\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Improved vision capabilities\"}]}]\nb2:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 have improved vision capabilities compared to previous Claude models. They perform better on image processing and data extraction tasks, particularly when there are multiple images present in context. You can also use these models to analyze videos by breaking them up into frames.\"}]}]\nb3:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"One technique we've found effective to further boost performance is to give Claude a crop tool or \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/overview\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"skill\"}],\". We've seen consistent uplift on image evaluations when Claude is able to \\\"zoom\\\" in on relevant regions of an image. We've put together a \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"https://platform.claude.com/cookbook/multimodal-crop-tool\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"cookbook for the crop tool\"}],\".\"]}]}]\nb4:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"frontend-design\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Frontend design\"}]}]\nb5:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 excel at building complex, real-world web applications with strong frontend design. However, without guidance, models can default to generic patterns that create what users call the \\\"AI slop\\\" aesthetic. To create distinctive, creative frontends that surprise and delight:\"}]}]\nb6:[\"$\",\"$L25\",null,{\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For a detailed guide on improving frontend design, see the blog post on \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"https://www.claude.com/blog/improving-frontend-design-through-skills\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"improving frontend design through skills\"}],\".\"]}]}]}]\nb7:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Here's a system prompt snippet you can use to encourage better frontend design:\"}]}]\ne2:T6fe,"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cfrontend_aesthetics\u003e\nYou tend to converge toward generic, \"on distribution\" outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the \"AI slop\" aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.\n\nFocus on:\n- Typography: Choose fonts that are beautiful, unique, and interesting. Avoid generic fonts like Arial and Inter; opt instead for distinctive choices that elevate the frontend's aesthetics.\n- Color \u0026 Theme: Commit to a cohesive aesthetic. Use CSS variables for consistency. Dominant colors with sharp accents outperform timid, evenly-distributed palettes. Draw from IDE themes and cultural aesthetics for inspiration.\n- Motion: Use animations for effects and micro-interactions. Prioritize CSS-only solutions for HTML. Use Motion library for React when available. Focus on high-impact moments: one well-orchestrated page load with staggered reveals (animation-delay) creates more delight than scattered micro-interactions.\n- Backgrounds: Create atmosphere and depth rather than defaulting to solid colors. Layer CSS gradients, use geometric patterns, or add contextual effects that match the overall aesthetic.\n\nAvoid generic AI-generated aesthetics:\n- Overused font families (Inter, Roboto, Arial, system fonts)\n- Clichd color schemes (particularly purple gradients on white backgrounds)\n- Predictable layouts and component patterns\n- Cookie-cutter design that lacks context-specific character\n\nInterpret creatively and make unexpected choices that feel genuinely designed for the context. Vary between light and dark themes, different fonts, different aesthetics. You still tend to converge on common choices (Space Grotesk, for example) across generations. Avoid this: it is critical that you think outside the box!\n\u003c/frontend_aesthetics\u003e"])</script><script nonce="rixKC7t4VfZkAGpZsPt5xw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"b8:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"$e2\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt for frontend encourage Claude to increase the quality and detail of its output can help better shape Claude's performance. For example, instead of \\\"Create an analytics dashboard\\\", use \\\"Create an analytics dashboard. Include as many relevant features and interactions as possible. Go beyond the basics to create a fully-featured implementation.\\\"\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Request specific features explicitly\"}],\": Animations and interactive elements should be requested explicitly when desired.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Update thinking configuration\"}],\": Claude 4.6 models use \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"adaptive thinking\"}],\" (\",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"thinking: {type: \\\"adaptive\\\"}\"}],\") instead of manual thinking with \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"budget_tokens\"}],\".
