It will generalize that style to its own extended thinking blocks.\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Manual CoT as a fallback.\"}],\" When thinking is off, you can still encourage step-by-step reasoning by asking Claude to think through the problem. Use structured tags like \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"\u003cthinking\u003e\"}],\" and \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"\u003canswer\u003e\"}],\" to cleanly separate reasoning from the final output.\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Ask Claude to self-check.\"}],\" Append something like \\\"Before you finish, verify your answer against [test criteria].\\\" This catches errors reliably, especially for coding and math.\"]}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"7f:[\"$\",\"$Ld4\",null,{\"children\":\"When extended thinking is disabled, Claude Opus 4.5 is particularly sensitive to the word \\\"think\\\" and its variants. Consider using alternatives like \\\"consider,\\\" \\\"evaluate,\\\" or \\\"reason through\\\" in those cases.\"}]\n80:[\"$\",\"$Ldb\",null,{\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For more information on thinking capabilities, see \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/extended-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"Extended thinking\"}],\" and \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"Adaptive thinking\"}],\".\"]}]}]}]\n81:[\"$\",\"h2\",null,{\"className\":\"font-heading leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"agentic-systems\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":2,\"children\":\"Agentic systems\"}]}]\n82:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"long-horizon-reasoning-and-state-tracking\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Long-horizon reasoning and state tracking\"}]}]\n83:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models excel at long-horizon reasoning tasks with exceptional state tracking capabilities. Claude maintains orientation across extended sessions by focusing on incremental progress, making steady advances on a few things at a time rather than attempting everything at once. This capability especially emerges over multiple context windows or task iterations, where Claude can work on a complex task, save the state, and continue with a fresh context window.\"}]}]\n84:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"context-awareness-and-multi-window-workflows\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":4,\"children\":\"Context awa"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"reness and multi-window workflows\"}]}]\n85:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"Claude 4.6 and Claude 4.5 models feature \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/context-windows#context-awareness-in-claude-sonnet-4-6-sonnet-4-5-and-haiku-4-5\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"context awareness\"}],\", enabling the model to track its remaining context window (i.e. \\\"token budget\\\") throughout a conversation. This enables Claude to execute tasks and manage context more effectively by understanding how much space it has to work.\"]}]}]\n86:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Managing context limits:\"}]}]}]\n87:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"If you are using Claude in an agent harness that compacts context or allows saving context to external files (like in Claude Code), consider adding this information to your prompt so Claude can behave accordingly. Otherwise, Claude may sometimes naturally try to wrap up work as it approaches the context limit. Below is an example prompt:\"}]}]\n88:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Your context window will be automatically compacted as it approaches its limit, allowing you to continue working indefinitely from where you left off. Therefore, do not stop tasks early due to token budget concerns. As you approach your token budget limit, save your current progress and state to memory before the context window refreshes. Always be as persistent and autonomous as possible and complete tasks fully, even if the end of your budget is approaching. Never artificially stop any task early regardless of the context remaining.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n89:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"chil"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"dren\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"The \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/agents-and-tools/tool-use/memory-tool\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"memory tool\"}],\" pairs naturally with context awareness for seamless context transitions.\"]}]}]\n8a:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"multi-context-window-workflows\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":4,\"children\":\"Multi-context window workflows\"}]}]\n8b:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"For tasks spanning multiple context windows:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"8c:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ol\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:[counter-reset:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Use a different prompt for the very first context window\"}],\": Use the first context window to set up a framework (write tests, create setup scripts), then use future context windows to iterate on a todo-list.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Have the model write tests in a structured format\"}],\": Ask Claude to create tests before starting work and keep track of them in a structured format (e.g., \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"tests.json\"}],\"). This leads to better long-term ability to iterate. Remind Claude of the importance of tests: \\\"It is unacceptable to remove or edit tests because this could lead to missing or buggy functionality.\\\"\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Set up quality of life tools\"}],\": Encourage Claude to create setup scripts (e.g., \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"init.sh\"}],\") to gracefully start servers, run test suites, and linters. This prevents repeated work when continuing from a fresh context window.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Starting fresh vs compacting\"}],\": When a context window is cleared, consider starting with a brand new context window rather than using compaction. Claude's latest models are extremely effective at discovering state from the local filesystem. In some cases, you may want to take advantage of this over compaction. Be prescriptive about how it should start:\"]}]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ul\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":\"\\\"Call pwd; you can only read and write files in this directory.\\\"\"}],\"\\n\",\"$Ldc\",\"\\n\",\"$Ldd\",\"\\n\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",\"$Lde\",\"\\n\",\"$Ldf\",\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"8d:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"This is a very long task, so it may be beneficial to plan out your work clearly. It's encouraged to spend your entire output context working on the task - just make sure you don't run out of context with significant uncommitted work. Continue working systematically until you have completed this task.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n8e:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"90:[\"$\",\"$L28\",null,{\"title\":\"Example: State tracking\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"json\",\"code\":\"// Structured state file (tests.json)\\n{\\n \\\"tests\\\": [\\n { \\\"id\\\": 1, \\\"name\\\": \\\"authentication_flow\\\", \\\"status\\\": \\\"passing\\\" },\\n { \\\"id\\\": 2, \\\"name\\\": \\\"user_management\\\", \\\"status\\\": \\\"failing\\\" },\\n { \\\"id\\\": 3, \\\"name\\\": \\\"api_endpoints\\\", \\\"status\\\": \\\"not_started\\\" }\\n ],\\n \\\"total\\\": 200,\\n \\\"passing\\\": 150,\\n \\\"failing\\\": 25,\\n \\\"not_started\\\": 25\\n}\",\"highlightedHtml\":\"$e0\"}],\"$Le1\"]}]\n91:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"balancing-autonomy-and-safety\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Balancing autonomy and safety\"}]}]\n92:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Without guidance, Claude Opus 4.6 may take actions that are difficult to reverse or affect shared systems, such as deleting files, force-pushing, or posting to external services. If you want Claude Opus 4.6 to confirm before taking potentially risky actions, add guidance to your prompt:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"93:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Consider the reversibility and potential impact of your actions. You are encouraged to take local, reversible actions like editing files or running tests, but for actions that are hard to reverse, affect shared systems, or could be destructive, ask the user before proceeding.\\n\\nExamples of actions that warrant confirmation:\\n- Destructive operations: deleting files or branches, dropping database tables, rm -rf\\n- Hard to reverse operations: git push --force, git reset --hard, amending published commits\\n- Operations visible to others: pushing code, commenting on PRs/issues, sending messages, modifying shared infrastructure\\n\\nWhen encountering obstacles, do not use destructive actions as a shortcut. For example, don't bypass safety checks (e.g. --no-verify) or discard unfamiliar files that may be in-progress work.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"94:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"research-and-information-gathering\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Research and information gathering\"}]}]\n95:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models demonstrate exceptional agentic search capabilities and can find and synthesize information from multiple sources effectively. nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"96:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ol\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 approach\"}],\":\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"97:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Search for this information in a structured way. As you gather data, develop several competing hypotheses. Track your confidence levels in your progress notes to improve calibration. Regularly self-critique your approach and plan. Update a hypothesis tree or research notes file to persist information and provide transparency. Break down this complex research task systematically.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt for complex research\"}]\n98:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"This structured approach allows Claude to find and synthesize virtually any piece of information and iteratively critique its findings, no matter the size of the corpus.\"}]}]\n99:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"subagent-orchestration\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Subagent orchestration\"}]}]\n9a:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models demonstrate significantly improved native subagent orchestration capabilities. These models can recognize when tasks would benefit from delegating work to specialized subagents and do so proactively without requiring explicit instruction.\"}]}]\n9b:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"To take advantage of this behavior:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"9c:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ol\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:[counter-reset:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Ensure well-defined subagent tools\"}],\": Have subagent tools available and described in tool definitions\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Let Claude orchestrate naturally\"}],\": Claude will delegate appropriately without explicit instruction\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Watch for overuse\"}],\": Claude Opus 4.6 has a strong predilection for subagents and may spawn them in situations where a simpler, direct approach would suffice. For example, the model may spawn subagents for code exploration when a direct grep call is faster and sufficient.\"]}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"9d:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"If you're seeing excessive subagent use, add explicit guidance about when subagents are and aren't warranted:\"}]}]\n9e:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Use subagents when tasks can run in parallel, require isolated context, or involve independent workstreams that don't need to share state. For simple tasks, sequential operations, single-file edits, or tasks where you need to maintain context across steps, work directly rather than delegating.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt for subagent usage\"}]\n9f:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"chain-complex-prompts\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Chain complex prompts\"}]}]\na0:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"With adaptive thinking and subagent orchestration, Claude handles most multi-step reasoning internally. Explicit prompt chaining breaking a task into sequential API calls is still useful when you need to inspect intermediate outputs or enforce a specific pipeline structure.\"}]}]\na1:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"The most common chaining pattern is \",[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"self-correction\"}],\": generate a draft have Claude review it against criteria have Claude refine based on the review. Each step is a separate API call so you can log, evaluate, or branch at any point.\"]}]}]\na2:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"reduce-file-creation-in-agentic-coding\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Reduce file creation in agentic coding\"}]}]\na3:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models may sometimes create new files for testing and iteration purposes, particularly when working with code. This approach allows Claude to use files, especially python scripts, as a 'temporary scratchpad' before saving its final output. Using temporary files can improve outcomes particularly for agentic coding use cases.\"}]}]\na4:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"If you'd prefer to minimize net new file creation, you can instruct Claude to clean up after itself:\"}]}]\na5:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"If you create any temporary new files, scripts, or helper files for iteration, clean up these files by removing them at the end of the task.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\na6:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"overeagerness\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Overeagerness\"}]}]\na7:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 have a tendency to overengineer by creating extra files, adding unnecessary abstractions, or building in flexibility that wasn't requested. If you're seeing this undesired behavior, add specific guidance to keep solutions minimal.\"}]}]\na8:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"For example:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"a9:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Avoid over-engineering. Only make changes that are directly requested or clearly necessary. Keep solutions simple and focused:\\n\\n- Scope: Don't add features, refactor code, or make \\\"improvements\\\" beyond what was asked. A bug fix doesn't need surrounding code cleaned up. A simple feature doesn't need extra configurability.\\n\\n- Documentation: Don't add docstrings, comments, or type annotations to code you didn't change. Only add comments where the logic isn't self-evident.\\n\\n- Defensive coding: Don't add error handling, fallbacks, or validation for scenarios that can't happen. Trust internal code and framework guarantees. Only validate at system boundaries (user input, external APIs).\\n\\n- Abstractions: Don't create helpers, utilities, or abstractions for one-time operations. Don't design for hypothetical future requirements. The right amount of complexity is the minimum needed for the current task.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt to minimize overengineering\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"aa:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"avoid-focusing-on-passing-tests-and-hard-coding\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Avoid focusing on passing tests and hard-coding\"}]}]\nab:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude can sometimes focus too heavily on making tests pass at the expense of more general solutions, or may use workarounds like helper scripts for complex refactoring instead of using standard tools directly. To prevent this behavior and ensure robust, generalizable solutions:\"}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"ac:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"Please write a high-quality, general-purpose solution using the standard tools available. Do not create helper scripts or workarounds to accomplish the task more efficiently. Implement a solution that works correctly for all valid inputs, not just the test cases. Do not hard-code values or create solutions that only work for specific test inputs. Instead, implement the actual logic that solves the problem generally.\\n\\nFocus on understanding the problem requirements and implementing the correct algorithm. Tests are there to verify correctness, not to define the solution. Provide a principled implementation that follows best practices and software design principles.\\n\\nIf the task is unreasonable or infeasible, or if any of the tests are incorrect, please inform me rather than working around them. The solution should be robust, maintainable, and extendable.\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"ad:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"minimizing-hallucinations-in-agentic-coding\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Minimizing hallucinations in agentic coding\"}]}]\nae:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude's latest models are less prone to hallucinations and give more accurate, grounded, intelligent answers based on the code. To encourage this behavior even more and minimize hallucinations:\"}]}]\naf:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"\u003cinvestigate_before_answering\u003e\\nNever speculate about code you have not opened. If the user references a specific file, you MUST read the file before answering. Make sure to investigate and read relevant files BEFORE answering questions about the codebase. Never make any claims about code before investigating unless you are certain of the correct answer - give grounded and hallucination-free answers.\\n\u003c/investigate_before_answering\u003e\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt\"}]\nb0:[\"$\",\"h2\",null,{\"className\":\"font-heading leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"capability-specific-tips\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":2,\"children\":\"Capability-specific tips\"}]}]\nb1:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"improved-vision-capabilities\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Improved vision capabilities\"}]}]\nb2:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 have improved vision capabilities compared to previous Claude models. They perform better on image processing and data extraction tasks, particularly when there are multiple images present in context. These improvements carry over to computer use, where the models can more reliably interpret screenshots and UI elements"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,". You can also use these models to analyze videos by breaking them up into frames.\"}]}]\nb3:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"One technique we've found effective to further boost performance is to give Claude a crop tool or \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/overview\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"skill\"}],\". We've seen consistent uplift on image evaluations when Claude is able to \\\"zoom\\\" in on relevant regions of an image. We've put together a \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"https://platform.claude.com/cookbook/multimodal-crop-tool\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"cookbook for the crop tool\"}],\".\"]}]}]\nb4:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"frontend-design\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Frontend design\"}]}]\nb5:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 excel at building complex, real-world web applications with strong frontend design. However, without guidance, models can default to generic patterns that create what users call the \\\"AI slop\\\" aesthetic. To create distinctive, creative frontends that surprise and delight:\"}]}]\nb6:[\"$\",\"$L25\",null,{\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For a detailed guide on improving frontend design, see the blog post on \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"https://www.claude.com/blog/improving-frontend-design-through-skills\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"improving frontend design through skills\"}],\".\"]}]}]}]\nb7:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":\"Here's a system prompt snippet you can use to encourage better frontend design:\"}]}]\ne2:T6fe,"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cfrontend_aesthetics\u003e\nYou tend to converge toward generic, \"on distribution\" outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the \"AI slop\" aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.\n\nFocus on:\n- Typography: Choose fonts that are beautiful, unique, and interesting. Avoid generic fonts like Arial and Inter; opt instead for distinctive choices that elevate the frontend's aesthetics.\n- Color \u0026 Theme: Commit to a cohesive aesthetic. Use CSS variables for consistency. Dominant colors with sharp accents outperform timid, evenly-distributed palettes. Draw from IDE themes and cultural aesthetics for inspiration.\n- Motion: Use animations for effects and micro-interactions. Prioritize CSS-only solutions for HTML. Use Motion library for React when available. Focus on high-impact moments: one well-orchestrated page load with staggered reveals (animation-delay) creates more delight than scattered micro-interactions.\n- Backgrounds: Create atmosphere and depth rather than defaulting to solid colors. Layer CSS gradients, use geometric patterns, or add contextual effects that match the overall aesthetic.\n\nAvoid generic AI-generated aesthetics:\n- Overused font families (Inter, Roboto, Arial, system fonts)\n- Clichd color schemes (particularly purple gradients on white backgrounds)\n- Predictable layouts and component patterns\n- Cookie-cutter design that lacks context-specific character\n\nInterpret creatively and make unexpected choices that feel genuinely designed for the context. Vary between light and dark themes, different fonts, different aesthetics. You still tend to converge on common choices (Space Grotesk, for example) across generations. Avoid this: it is critical that you think outside the box!\n\u003c/frontend_aesthetics\u003e"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"b8:[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"text\",\"code\":\"$e2\",\"label\":\"Sample prompt for frontend \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/blob/main/plugins/frontend-design/skills/frontend-design/SKILL.md\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"full encourage Claude to increase the quality and detail of its output can help better shape Claude's performance. For example, instead of \\\"Create an analytics dashboard\\\", use \\\"Create an analytics dashboard. Include as many relevant features and interactions as possible. Go beyond the basics to create a fully-featured implementation.\\\"\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Request specific features explicitly\"}],\": Animations and interactive elements should be requested explicitly when desired.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Update thinking configuration\"}],\": Claude 4.6 models use \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"adaptive thinking\"}],\" (\",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"thinking: {type: \\\"adaptive\\\"}\"}],\") instead of manual thinking with \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"budget_tokens\"}],\". See \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"#migrating-away-from-prefilled-responses\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"Migrating away from prefilled responses\"}],\" for detailed guidance on alternatives.\"]}]}],\"\\n\"]}],\"\\n\",\"$Le3\",\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"bd:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"For detailed migration steps, see the \",[\"$\",\"$L26\",null,{\"href\":\"/docs/en/about-claude/models/migration-guide\",\"className\":\"inline-link\",\"children\":\"Migration guide\"}],\".\"]}]}]\nbe:[\"$\",\"h3\",null,{\"className\":\"text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"migrating-from-claude-sonnet-4-5-to-claude-sonnet-4-6\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":3,\"children\":\"Migrating from Claude Sonnet 4.5 to Claude Sonnet 4.6\"}]}]\nbf:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"Claude Sonnet 4.6 defaults to an effort level of \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"high\"}],\", in contrast to Claude Sonnet 4.5 which had no effort parameter. Consider adjusting the effort parameter as you migrate from Claude Sonnet 4.5 to Claude Sonnet 4.6. If not explicitly set, you may experience higher latency with the default effort level.\"]}]}]\nc0:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"c1:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"list\",\"className\":\"mb-4\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"ul\",null,{\"className\":\"list-none pl-8 [\u0026_ul]:pl-8 [\u0026_ol]:pl-8\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center recommended) at medium or high effort to give the model room to think and act\"}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"c2:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 problems (large-scale code migrations, deep research, extended autonomous work), Opus 4.6 remains the right choice. Sonnet 4.6 is optimized for workloads where fast turnaround and cost efficiency matter most.\"]}]}]\nc3:[\"$\",\"h4\",null,{\"className\":\"text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L27\",null,{\"slug\":\"if-you-re-not-using-extended-thinking\",\"className\":\"pt-6 pb-2\",\"headingLevel\":4,\"children\":\"If you're not using extended thinking\"}]}]\nc4:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"If you're not using extended thinking on Claude Sonnet 4.5, you can continue without it on Claude Sonnet 4.6. You should explicitly set effort to the level appropriate for your use case. At \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"low\"}],\" effort with thinking disabled, you can expect similar or better performance relative to Claude Sonnet 4.5 with no extended thinking.\"]}]}]\ne4:Tb09,"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cpre class=\"shiki shiki-themes github-light-default dark-plus\" style=\"--shiki-light:#1f2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6;--shiki-light-bg:transparent;--shiki-dark-bg:transparent\" tabindex=\"0\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6\"\u003eclient.messages.create(\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#953800;--shiki-dark:#9CDCFE\"\u003e model\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#CF222E;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan Adaptive thinking lets the model calibrate its reasoning per step, staying on path over longer trajectories. For these workloads, start at \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"high\"}],\" effort. If latency or token usage is a concern, scale down to \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"medium\"}],\".\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Computer use agents:\"}],\" Claude Sonnet 4.6 achieved best-in-class accuracy on computer use evaluations using adaptive mode.\"]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Bimodal workloads:\"}],\" a mix of easy and hard tasks where adaptive skips thinking on simple queries and reasons deeply on complex ones.\"]}],\"\\n\"]}]}]\n"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"d1:[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[\"When using adaptive thinking, evaluate \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"medium\"}],\" and \",[\"$\",\"code\",null,{\"className\":\"relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone\",\"children\":\"high\"}],\" effort on your tasks. The right level depends on your workload's tradeoff between quality, latency, and token usage.\"]}]}]\ne7:Tb0b,"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cpre class=\"shiki shiki-themes github-light-default dark-plus\" style=\"--shiki-light:#1f2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6;--shiki-light-bg:transparent;--shiki-dark-bg:transparent\" tabindex=\"0\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6\"\u003eclient.messages.create(\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#953800;--shiki-dark:#9CDCFE\"\u003e thinking\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan {{PATIENT01_APPOINTMENT_HISTORY}}\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e \u0026#x3C;/\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#116329;--shiki-dark:#569CD6\"\u003edocument_content\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e \u0026#x3C;/\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#116329;--shiki-dark:#569CD6\"\u003edocument\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u0026#x3C;/\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#116329;--shiki-dark:#569CD6\"\u003edocuments\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"line\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6\"\u003eFind quotes from the patient records and appointment history that are relevant to diagnosing the patient's reported symptoms. Place these in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u0026#x3C;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#116329;--shiki-dark:#569CD6\"\u003equotes\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6\"\u003e tags. Then, based on these quotes, list all information that would help the doctor diagnose the patient's symptoms. Place your diagnostic information in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u0026#x3C;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#116329;--shiki-dark:#569CD6\"\u003einfo\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#808080\"\u003e\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6\"\u003e tags.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e"])</script><script nonce="qPB0hcm2ptCoe+VPl9Okkw==">self.__next_f.push([1,"d6:[\"$\",\"li\",null,{\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[''] [ol\u003e\u0026]:before:content-[counter(item)'.'] [ol\u003e\u0026]:[counter-increment:item]\",\"children\":[\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L24\",null,{\"contentType\":\"paragraph\",\"minLength\":20,\"className\":\"mb-2 last:mb-0\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"p\",null,{\"children\":[[\"$\",\"strong\",null,{\"className\":\"font-semibold\",\"children\":\"Ground responses in quotes\"}],\": For long document tasks, ask Claude to quote relevant parts of the documents first before carrying out its task. This helps Claude cut through the noise of the rest of the document's contents.\"]}]}],\"\\n\",[\"$\",\"$L28\",null,{\"title\":\"Example quote extraction\",\"children\":[\"$\",\"$L29\",null,{\"language\":\"xml\",\"code\":\"You are an AI physician's assistant.
